element.name: The Scalp by MadraRua, Traditional Cache (2/2.5)
element.description: Traditional 'Cache with a View' on the border between Dublin and Wicklow.
element.long-description:
It is recommended to park at the provided coordinates and approach the cache from there.
Visit the friendly & helpful Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE
Parking
N 53° 13.240’ W 006° 10.255’
(the car park is closed over night)
It is NOT recommended to approach the cache site from the West (although there are tracks leading up to it). (As always in the Dublin/Wicklow Mountains area, don't leave any valuables lie open in the car and open the glove compartment to show that it's empty)
The Scalp in 'days of yore'.
"The Scalp is a deep gash in the hills of County Dublin through which the R117 Dublin – Enniskerry road goes. There is only a miserable little stream in it now, obviously quite incapable of having carved its way 100 m down through solid granite. It is in fact a glacial overflow channel , cut at the end of the last Ice Age when the the melting ice created a great lake of melt water trapped between the ice in the north and the Dublin Mountains. Eventually the water rose high enough to top the ridge and the power of the huge volume of escaping water cut out the Scalp as we know it." (from Joss Lynam, 'Easy Walks near Dublin', Gill & Macmillan 1999)
element.additional-waypoints:
PKX654 - Barnaslingan Woods Car Park
N 53째 13.240 W 006째 10.255
A Coillte car park. http://www.coillte.ie/recreation/recreation_sites/dublin/barnaslingan/ This will close in the evening so check the times.
element.encoded-hints: under rock and near dead pine tree

ul.li:
2010-06-02T19:00:00Z : Found it by MomoWhere
My second cache on my first day, went with Qper. love the view, took a tissue paper as i need it, thank you for it, i left nothing i had nothing organize.. but i will go back another time. thanks !!

2010-04-22T19:00:00Z : Found it by kaputing
Can't believe I'd never been here. Great day for a walk. Quick find in gorgeous spot. Thanks for it.

2010-04-19T19:00:00Z : Found it by Peta Amalka
I have absolutely enjoyed this cache...the view is beautiful and the forest around looks so peaceful. We were lucky with weather today. TFTC

2010-04-17T19:00:00Z : Found it by GRIMB0
Crackin day...

2010-02-27T20:00:00Z : Found it by EIMHK
Found it - beautiful views from the cache site, you can see all the way over to the sugarloaf.
Out: TB
TFTC

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: The Scalp
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:short_description: Traditional 'Cache with a View' on the border between Dublin and Wicklow.
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
It is recommended to park at the provided coordinates and approach the cache from there.

Visit the friendly & helpful Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE
Parking
N 53° 13.240’ W 006° 10.255’
(the car park is closed over night)

It is NOT recommended to approach the cache site from the West (although there are tracks leading up to it).

(As always in the Dublin/Wicklow Mountains area, don't leave any valuables lie open in the car and open the glove compartment to show that it's empty)

The Scalp in 'days of yore'.


"The Scalp is a deep gash in the hills of County Dublin through which the R117 Dublin – Enniskerry road goes. There is only a miserable little stream in it now, obviously quite incapable of having carved its way 100 m down through solid granite. It is in fact a glacial overflow channel , cut at the end of the last Ice Age when the the melting ice created a great lake of melt water trapped between the ice in the north and the Dublin Mountains. Eventually the water rose high enough to top the ridge and the power of the huge volume of escaping water cut out the Scalp as we know it."

(from Joss Lynam, 'Easy Walks near Dublin', Gill & Macmillan 1999)
